author: mattja
title: 96% of Boeing machinists vote to strike - Politics and Other Controversies -Democrats, Republicans, Libertarians, Conservatives, Liberals, Third Parties, Left-Wing, Right-Wing, Congress, President - City-Data Forum
text:
From the horse's mouth.
https://www.iam751.org/?zone=/uniona...&HomeID=927163
Quote: Boeing Machinists union members reject contract, strike
Boeing Machinists union members voted Thursday to reject the deal between the aerospace giant and union leaders, and to go on strike beginning at 12 a.m. Friday.
The proposed deal — reached early Sunday morning — offered the union’s 33,000 workers a 25% general wage increase, enhanced retirement benefits, fewer hours of mandatory overtime work and increased parental leave.
But workers said the contract doesn’t go far enough. Union leader Jon Holden said earlier this week he expected rank-and-file members to reject the contract and strike.
Of the voting members, 95% voted to reject the contract and 96% voted to strike; the union had to have a two-thirds majority vote to strike.
https://www.seattletimes.com/busines...act-or-strike/ It appears the offer was as follows:
* 11% immediate pay increase
* 4% annual wage increases in 2025 and 2026; 6% in 2027
* $3,000 ratification bonus
* Small decrease in monthly health care premiums
Details of rejected package below.
https://i.imgur.com/BGnYTuZ.jpeg
https://i.imgur.com/p3M106R.jpeg
https://i.imgur.com/cEOwSoK.jpeg
